If you need to talk to your counselor, fill out this Google Form and they will contact you!

span.div: Hi Everyone! I hope everyone is doing well during the crazy and different times. I'm missing each and everyone of you. If you would like to contact me about anything please email me at: tina.billman@hardin.k12.mt.usor leave a message at my school number: 665-6357.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.div: If you would like from me to call you please leave a phone number you can be reached at. I would love to talk and visit with you about life, what you've been doing, school work, and just about anything really. I love and miss my students.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: Also, if you picked up or need an Upward Bound Application please email me or call me so we can figure out a way to get the application turned in. Dan Benge, with Upward Bound still plans on picking up the applications on April 3rd. Thanks!

a.onclick: ga('send', 'event', 'URL', 'Link', 'Special Board Meeting - Click here to join!');

div.a: Special Board Meeting - Click here to join!

div.span: **Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting. Join Zoom Meeting Thursday, April 30, 2020 @ 6:00 p.m. MST

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: To: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 Students, Parents, Staff and Community Members

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: From: Eldon C. Johnson, Superintendent

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Re: COVID-19 Update Week of April 20, 2020

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Greetings Hardin School District 17H & 1 Students, Parents, Staff and Community Members,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We continue to wish you safety and health during these challenging times. The District is working tirelessly to provide the best possible educational opportunities that currently exist; however, we continue to face daily challengesespecially in lieu of the Governors latest declaration. We continue to appreciate all the students, parents and staff for their unwavering dedication to make this situation as bearable as possible. We thank you for your continued flexibility and support; we know that this is a difficult situation for all!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Governor Bullock, in his declaration posted this past Wednesday, stated that public schools across the state of Montana can CHOOSE to open their doors to students and staff come May 7, 2020. He is lifting his closure order and placing that decision and responsibility in the hands of the communities and ultimately the local school boards and/or county health departments with the FOCUS to remain on what is in the best interests of not ONLY our students and staff, but also the safety and welfare of our communities! The order is also relatively explicit on the parameters in which the schools can openlimiting class sizes, maintaining current social distancing protocol according to CDC recommendations, limited building access to all non-students/non-staff and consideration of loss of students and staff for MULTIPLE reasons once the buildings reopen.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Again, we go back to what does this look like for Hardin School Districts and education for the remainder of this school year? The Montana Office of Public Instruction has suggested that schools plan for closure through the end of the school year and to start planning alternative graduation ceremonies. I have been in many meetings over the past two days with educational leaders from across the State of Montana, Crow Tribal Leadership and the Big Horn County Health Department and take their input and recommendations seriously. The seriousness of the COVID-19 pandemic has not gone away and to be quite honest, will potentially exist into next school year. In consultation with the entities mentioned above, as well as administration within the major departments/schools in our District, I fully intend to support and detail the following to our Board of Trustees at the special meeting scheduled for April 30, 2020 at 6:00 p.m. by remote access:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In light of the Governors declaration made on April 24, 2020...I feel strongly that I will recommend that the board of trustees declare an unforeseen emergency within the meaning of that term as set forth in Title 20, Chapter 9, Part 8, to becomeimmediately effective and to continue through June 30, 2020. This motion is based on COVID-19 risks; inrecognition that the Governor's waiver of student instruction time will expire on May 7; and in recognition that the Governor's April 22, 2020 Directive implicatingExecutive Orders 2-2020 and 3-2020specify that elected school boards and their districts that adopt their own declaration of emergency will continue to receive all state funding, including transportation funding."

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This recommendation will ask the Board to finish the current school year under the same conditions and plans as submitted to the Governor on March 27, 2020. This will allow for continuity in our current educational delivery system and our school nutrition program. It is known that this may not be the best educational delivery model for all students, but I do feel confident that this is the best case scenario for all of our students, staff, families and community members.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This recommendation takes into consideration an endless amount of information from many sources, but reflects the research and input of our most trusted political and health-related officials across the state and throughout Big Horn County. I feel that this recommendation is made with the best interests of ALL members of our school system and community in mindsafety and protection still remain our top priority at this time.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No determination has yet to be made on graduation and my heart goes out to all seniors, but we are working on a couple of possible avenues and wish to present those options at the Board meeting on the 30

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: of April, 2020 for informational purposes only. We continue to take suggestions and thoughts through our email help line, but please understand the complexities and restrictions are still in place and there are many factors that need to be considered when finalizing graduation.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: At this point, we are still unsure of what any of our summer programs may look like. We are having daily meetings on how we will deliver summer school opportunities, drivers education and other activitiesif they are offered at all.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please note that the preliminary recommendation and other suggestions above

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 700; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: MAY CHANGE

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: as updated relevant information becomes available. Please see the special board meeting protocol outlined below

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Special Board Meeting April 30, 2020 at 6:00 p.m.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: The meeting will be held by ZOOM with the entry information posted on our website NO LATER than Wednesday, April 29

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please RSVP your attendance by emailing us your FULL NAME and details of your COMMENTS to

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; color: #0563c1; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . Without this RSVP and ability to fully identify yourself at the ZOOM meeting, you may not be allowed to enter, so advance notice is extremely important.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Entrance to the meeting will conclude at 6:15 p.m. sharp!

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Meeting comment procedures and protocol will also be placed on our website with the meeting information.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please, if you have any questions or comments, send them to

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; color: #0563c1; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: and we will make sure to review them at the special meeting to be held April 30, 2020 at 6:00 p.m. by ZOOM meeting.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Thank you and remain safe and healthy!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Eldon C. Johnson, Supt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: April 22, 2020

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dear Hardin School District 17H & 1 Students, Parents, Staff & Community Members,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please find at the bottom of this notice a link to Governor Bullock's 4/22/2020 declaration of guidance for the phased reopening of Montana and establishing conditions for Phase One.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: I am sure that most of you, much like myself, watched the noon press conference today where the Governor outlined the current COVID-19 updates and his directives to slowly open commerce, education and health care across the State of Montana in a calculated and direct manner. Though we still have MUCH to do and so many things to consider as we move forward, please know that this is NOT an easy "snap-of-the-finger" process.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Many factors such as student/staff/family safety, group sizes, social distancing, school nutrition, custodial upkeep and transportation will be analyzed before any final decisions are made by the Hardin Schools District 17H & 1 Board of Trustees. I can guarantee you that this decision will not be easy and not be made lightly; however, we will continue to seek the professional wisdom and input of our local authorities to help guide us through this process.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: It is our full intention to make a determination on the guidelines that will govern our District within the next couple of weeks. As I mentioned yesterday, Senior Graduation continues to weigh heavily on our minds...but nothing has changed regarding social distancing rules and gathering protocols, which continues to "muddy the waters". You will also notice that the Montana High School Association has officially cancelled all MHSA spring sanctioned events.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: I will continue to work with our county officials, our school administration and our Board of Trustees to do what is in the best interests of all stakeholders. Please continue to monitor our Facebook page and website for further updates and correspondence.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Respectfully,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Eldon C. Johnson,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Supt Hardin School Districts 17H & 1

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Governor Bullock's 4/22/2020 declaration of guidance for the phased reopening of Montana and establishing conditions for Phase One.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: To: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 Students, Parents, Staff and Community Members

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: From: Eldon C. Johnson, Superintendent

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Re: COVID-19 Update Week of April 20, 2020

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dear Bulldog Family and Friends,

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We continue to wish you safety and health during these extraordinary times; new challenges are presented daily as we continue to navigate the COVID-19 pandemic. The District is trying to provide the best possible educational opportunities that currently exist; however, we cannot do this without the help of all the students/families...we appreciate and respect the difficult times this has brought everyone and look to continue to provide the best support available. Please, as a student and/or parent who has yet to be contacted by the appropriate school, contact us at

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: or at 406-665-9312. We will do everything we can to make this transition as smooth as possible, while still maintaining standards of expectations. THANK YOU!

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Since my last correspondence, not a whole lot has changed. It is expected that Governor Bullock will address Montana VERY SOON on his plans for reopening Montana. We know that President Trump has discussed opening up America in phases and leaving the Governors in control on how that looks in their states. What does this look like for Hardin School Districts and the state of Montana? The educational organizations statewide feel that the closure will continue through the end of the school year. The Montana Office of Public Instruction has suggested that schools plan for closure through the end of the school year and to start planning alternative graduation ceremonies. The big question that has come up is what if Governor Bullock lifts the stay at home order and says that school closure is over...what does this mean for our students, parents and staff? If the Governor says that schools will reopen, it still is up to local control by action of the Board of Trustees and/or the Big Horn County Health Department. In the event that Governor Bullock states that schools may reopen, a special meeting may have to be held later this week to determine the course of action.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We have been thinking a lot about all of our students, especially our seniors. Senior year is not supposed to be this way and we all understand what a special occasion this should be...definitely memorable! The best thing we could do is to continue to be optimistic, keep our heads up, and strive for that high school diploma. A big concern right now is how graduation will look, which at this time is an uncertainty. Please know that we are keeping you close in our thoughts and trying hard to make your graduation as special as we can during this time. We continue to brainstorm ideas and will hopefully be able to provide more details based upon the decisions of the Governor later this week!

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: To all of our students and families, we ask you to continue to do your best during this trying event...communicating with your schools and teachers during this time is essential. We appreciate all of the support throughout the community; our teachers, school nutrition staff, our paraprofessionals taking on new roles and responsibilities, our transportation contractors, all building leaders...and especially our frontline health care providers throughout Big Horn County providing us knowledge and understanding of this ever-changing pandemic.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Again, thank you and remain safe and healthy!

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Eldon C. Johnson, Supt

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

u.strong: MHSA will send weekly updates each Monday or sooner if informational becomes available!

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 1.5em
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em

overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 1.5em

overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 1.5em

ul.li: The MHSA Executive Board, during a conference call to conduct Association business on Thursday morning, took the following action regarding MHSA Spring Activities: All MHSA spring activities will be suspended through April 24th. This includes practices and contests/meet/festivals. Resumption of spring activities will depend on our students ability to return to in-person instruction by May 4th. If in-person instruction doesnt resume by that time, spring activities will be cancelled. We take seriously the directives from the Governor, State Health Department and CDC for the safety of our students and for their communities. Their safety is our top priority during these challenging times.

li.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.5em 15px; overflow-wrap: break-word; line-height: 16.9px; text-align: justify

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt

span.span: If spring activities are resumed, the practice requirement for sports at that time will be five practices from resumption except for golf which will be the normal two practices required.

li.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.5em 15px; overflow-wrap: break-word; line-height: 16.9px; text-align: justify

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt

span.span: If spring activities are resumed, post season formats will be adjusted by the MHSA with Executive Board approval.

p.style: margin: 0px 0in 1em 0.5in; overflow-wrap: break-word; line-height: 18.2px; color: #333333; text-align: justify

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 1.5em

span.span: The MHSA April Executive Board meeting scheduled for April 20-21 has been postponed tentatively until May 18-19, 2020, depending on the directives from the Governor, State Health Department at that time.

div.span: Montana GEAR UP Surveys for Parents and Students

GEAR UP hopes to see you succeed in college and your career after high school. We would like to hear about your plans and get your feedback about how we can help you meet your goals. This survey will take 5 to 10 minutes. You can take the survey on a computer, a phone, or a tablet. Please complete the survey by May 8, 2020.

Please help us improve GEAR UP for your child or children by taking this survey. The survey will take 5 to 10 minutes to complete. You can take the survey on a computer, phone, tablet or other mobile device. Paper surveys are also available from your GEAR UP liaison. Please complete the survey by May 8, 2020.

Please come in to the schools if you are new to our district. You will fill out the form in the above link and then the school staff will have to enroll your child. We will then give you usernames and passwords to complete the enrollment forms.

and skills that foster responsible choices. The school community will nurture, challenge, and guide students towards
achieving their maximum potential.
